etymology.description: 广(广) (guǎng, "house built to depend on a cliff") + 占(占) (zhān, "divine") = house component gives a context of a structure + phonetic component provides sound -> shop
etymology.interpretation: The character 店(店) (diàn, "shop") combines a component representing a building structure, underlining its meaning as a place of commerce, with a phonetic element that hints at its pronunciation.

parts.english: house built to depend on a cliff

examples.chinese: 这家店很好(這家店很好)。
店里人很多(店裡人很多)。
examples.english: There are many people in the shop.

examples.chinese: 他去那家店(他去那家店)，买东西(買東西)。
examples.pinyin: Tā qù nà jiā diàn, mǎi dōngxi.
examples.english: He goes to that shop to buy things.
